title: Operation: Simoom *1999* [DVDRip][XviD][AC3][PL+English subs]
description:
The film is telling a fictional story, however for which true events were a background. Operation Simoom (Polish: Operacja Samum) - was a top secret Polish Intelligence operation conducted in Iraq in 1990.

Title: Operacja Samum (Operation: Simoom)
Production: Poland / year: 1999 / type: Movie
Genres: drama / action / spy / non-fiction
Language: Polish / +English subtitles

all subtitles:
English, Czech

The film is a fictional account of Operation Simoom - a top secret Polish Intelligence operation to withdraw CIA agents before the start of the Persian Gulf War. In 1990 the CIA asked European intelligence agencies to assist in the withdrawal of six American operatives (a mix of CIA and DIA officers) investigating Iraqi troops movements in Iraq before the Gulf War. Several countries, such as: Soviet Union, Great Britain and France - refused to help in such a dangerous operation. Only Poland agreed to help.
The action of movie takes place after the Iraqi invasion of Kuwait in 1990. The film then shifts to Baghdad - where Iraqi security forces raid a CIA safehouse maintained by CIA agent Jeff Magnus (Kristof Konrad). Walton and his two other CIA agents manage to escape into hiding as they prepare to leave Iraq before a possible war. Walton is warned by a Polish-American a Shin Bet agent, named Karen Pierce (Anna Korcz) to leave Iraq immediately.
